attributes.action: Deploy dedicated hospital shuttle buses for the areas around Salford Royal
attributes.additional_details: They are having to spend more money, and more effort catching buses, just to get to work on time, and save people, while there are a lot less bus times and or services, making it doubly hard for them to get to work, and treat and save people.
attributes.background: NHS Frontliners should all be afforded this benefit, as they are the ones fighting to save the people of this country. Have dedicated shuttles, at appropriates times, in-line with regular shift times, carefully planned around a certain grid area, around a certain hospital/clinic.

rejection.details:
The Government is not responsible for providing public transport in particular areas. This would be a matter for the relevant local authority.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

During lock-down the Government should pay for all NHS staff's travel expenses: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/316927

Fund free Travel, Parking, Hotel & Childcare during COVID-19 for NHS staff: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/305854

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you find out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/
